title: Lizardman shaman

properties.name: description
properties.value: Lizardman shamans are giant reptilian humanoids that are stronger than their normal lizardmen and lizardmen brute counterparts. They are often sought after for their dragon warhammer drops. They never become tolerant to the player.

content:
This article is about the shamans encountered on the surface. For the Chambers of Xeric variant, see Lizardman shaman (Chambers of Xeric).
 This article has money making guides: Killing Lizardman Shamans (Settlement or Temple), Killing Lizardman Shamans (Canyon).
Please add tips to the subpages, rather than the article below.
This article has a strategy guide here.
All information on mechanics and strategy will be on this page.
This article has a Slayer task guide here.
Information comparing locations for Slayer tasks will be on this page

Lizardman shamans are giant reptilian humanoids that are stronger than their normal lizardmen and lizardmen brute counterparts. They are often sought after for their dragon warhammer drops. They never become tolerant to the player.

Players are required to have 100% Shayzien favour in order to kill lizardman shamans.

Locations[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Spawns Map
Lizardman Canyon, west side (requires 100% Shayzien favour)1503Maplink
Lizardman Caves, underneath Lizardman Settlement (Slayer task only)1508Maplink
Lizardman Temple, beneath Molch1506Maplink

Lizardman Canyon[edit | edit source]

Three shamans reside in the western area of Lizardman Canyon, and is completely multi-combat. Shayzien soldiers will not attack the shamans (nor will the shamans attack them), since they are busy dealing with a small group of lizardmen. Below are a couple ways to get there. Fairy rings are the fastest way to reach them. These three shamans are present in a multi-combat area.

Players can check how many players are currently in the western area of the canyon by speaking to the wounded soldier outside the canyon, just south of the broken crossbow.

Warning: The player should be wary if more than one shaman attacks them at a time as they can quickly stack up damage from their abilities and attacks, which can quickly end a trip. If the players do not want to be attacked constantly by the nearby lizardmen and their brute forms, killing the ones in the north and south-west corners is recommended.

Xeric's talisman[edit | edit source]

  1. Use Xeric's talisman to teleport to Xeric's Inferno.
  2. Run south through Lovakengj.
  3. Once you've reached the south end near some giant bats and a house with a water source, head a bit west to reach some patrolling Kourend guards.
  4. Go south into the canyon and down the handholds to the west.

Fairy rings[edit | edit source]

Partial completion of Fairytale II - Cure a Queen is required to use the fairy rings. A fairy ring (code DJR) is nearby, just south of Lizardman Canyon.

Lizardman Caves[edit | edit source]

From Xeric's Look-Out, follow the blue arrow to reach the shamans.

Eight shamans reside inside a cave at the northern end of the Lizardman Settlement before Xeric's Shrine. This is a single-way combat area. This location requires players to be on a lizardman Slayer task. A dwarf multicannon cannot be used here.

Xeric's talisman[edit | edit source]

  1. Use Xeric's talisman to teleport to Xeric's Honour.
  2. Run Southeast to the Mountain Guide and travel to Shayziens' Wall.
  3. Once there, head west past some lizardman brutes.
  4. The shamans are inside the Lizardman Caves, and Xeric's Shrine is due north past the bridge.

Fairy rings[edit | edit source]

  1. Use the fairy ring code: CIR — requires partial completion of Fairytale II - Cure a Queen.
  2. Run south past the farming guild.
  3. Run over the bridge past the Shayzien soldier's guarding the exit of the bridge.
  4. The shamans are inside the Lizardman Caves, and Xeric's Shrine is due north past the bridge.

Attacks[edit | edit source]

Lizardman shamans have several special attacks that they can utilise during the fight. Excluding the spawns, these attacks do not have a cooldown so it is possible for a lizardman shaman to repeatedly use the same ability over and over again.

  • A green acidic attack that will deal 25-30 damage. Wearing tiers 1-4 Shayzien armour will reduce the damage of this attack greatly; wearing a full set of tier 5 Shayzien armour will reduce this damage to 0. This attack can also cause poison starting at 10 damage.
    • Players who have completed the hard Kourend & Kebos Diary can talk to Captain Cleive to be able to wear their Slayer helmet or Slayer helmet (i) as a Shayzien helm (5).
  • A jump attack that targets a small area where the player was previously standing on. If the player is in that landing area when the shaman crashes down, they will be dealt with 20-25 typeless damage. This jump has a 3x3 AoE (2x2 in the temple, with the player's position as the northeast tile) and is not used if the jump location is obstructed.
  • It may summon several small purple spawns that appear next to the player. After a few seconds, the spawns will explode. The damage dealt is anywhere from 5-10 depending on the player's proximity next to them; their explosion covers a 5x5 area (3x3 area in the slayer area), or a 2 tile radius from them (1 tile in the temple).

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 292,640 kills from the Drop Rate Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average Lizardman shaman kill is worth 14,937. Excluding the dragon warhammer, the average kill is worth 6,802.

Combat Achievements[edit | edit source]

The following Combat Achievement tasks involve lizardman shamans.

Name Description Difficulty Category
A Scaley Encounter Kill a Lizardman Shaman. Easy Kill count
Shayzien Protector Kill a Lizardman Shaman in Molch which has not dealt damage to anyone. (excluding it's Spawns) Easy Perfection

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
14 January 2019
(update) 		Hotfix

Lizardman Shaman spawns in the Lizardmen Temple now have a 3x3 explosion radius down from 5x5. [3]

Gallery[edit | edit source]

  • A lighter variant.

  • A darker variant.

  • The variant found in the Lizardman Temple.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • When the Chambers of Xeric was released, two shamans were added into the Lizardman Settlement. Unlike the shamans at the canyon, these did not require 100% favour. This led to backlash, as it removed the primary incentive to gain Shayzien favour. These shamans were eventually removed in favour of a task-only area on 13 July 2017. In the same update, safespots in the canyon were removed.
  • On release, shamans could summon spawns in quick succession. This was changed in an update on 8 February 2018.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Mod Kieren's Twitter account. 11 February 2016. (Archived from the original on 25 March 2019.) Mod Kieren: "Okay, we reached enough retweets! Here you go, the Dragon Warhammer drop rate. [1]"
  2. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 28 February 2019. (Archived from the original on 8 November 2019.) Mod Ash: "You have a 1/50 chance of getting to the seed table"
  3. ↑ Jagex. Old School RuneScape's Twitter account. 14 January 2019. (Archived from the original on 25 May 2020.)
